title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
topic: the novel’s about racism in the American South

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
topic: the novel’s about interactions with mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby

title: Ulysses
author: James Joyce
topic: the novel’s about Odysseus’s journey home after the Trojan War

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J. D Salinger
topic: the novel’s about the loss of innocence

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
topic: the novel’s about the turbulent relationship between Fitzwilliam Darcy and Elizabeth Bennet, the daughter of a country gentleman

title: Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
topic: the novel’s central character and narrator runs away from his abusive father, together with his companion, Jim the runaway slave

title: Alice’s Adventure in Wonderland
author: Lewis Carroll
topic: the novel’s about teaching moral lessons

title: To the Lighthouse
author: Virginia Woolf
topic: the novel’s around the Ramsay Family, as well as their visits to the Isle of Skye in Scotland between 1910 and 1920

title: The Sound and the Fury
author: William Faulkner.
topic: the novel’s around the Compson family, former Southern aristocrats who are facing a hard time dealing with the dissolution of their family and its reputation

title: Nineteen Eighty-four
author: George Orwell
topic: the novel’s a warning against totalitarianism
